metadata.job_title: Sr. Data Engineer(hands on Palantir exp.)

data_maturity_score.evidence: Reliance on Hadoop ecosystem (Hive, PySpark) suggests developing maturity; no modern stack tools (dbt, Airflow, Snowflake) or governance practices mentioned.

data_maturity_level.evidence: Matches score of 2 - basic batch pipelines with Hadoop, no advanced tooling or governance mentioned.

maturity_signals.evidence: Palantir Foundry is a modern platform, but Hadoop ecosystem suggests legacy infrastructure; no CI/CD, testing, or monitoring tools mentioned.

scope_creep_score.evidence: Focused role on Palantir Foundry and Hadoop stack; no conflation with data science, analytics, or DevOps responsibilities.

overtime_risk_score.evidence: Onsite requirement and 'locals only' may imply operational pressure; no PTO or work-life balance signals mentioned.

role_clarity.evidence: Specific requirements (Palantir Foundry, Hadoop, Hive, PySpark) and seniority level (8-10 years) provide clear scope.

overall_red_flag_score.evidence: Moderate risk due to onsite requirement and lack of benefits/work-life signals, but role is well-defined with high experience requirement.

reporting_structure_clarity.evidence: No information about reporting manager or team structure in job description.

manager_level_inferred.evidence: No managerial titles or reporting structure mentioned in job posting.

team_growth_velocity.evidence: No information about team size, growth trajectory, or hiring plans provided.

team_composition.evidence: No details about team size or composition in job description.

reporting_structure.evidence: No reporting structure details provided in job posting.

cross_functional_embedded.evidence: No mention of working with product teams, PMs, or cross-functional collaboration; likely centralized data team.

work_life_balance_score.evidence: Onsite requirement and 'locals only' suggest potential for long hours; no PTO, flexibility, or work-life balance signals mentioned.

growth_opportunities_score.evidence: No mention of learning budget, conferences, mentorship, or career progression paths.

tech_culture_score.evidence: Palantir Foundry is modern, but Hadoop stack suggests legacy environment; no engineering practices (CI/CD, testing, code review) mentioned.

tech_culture_signals.evidence: No mention of open source, tech blogs, conference speaking, hackathons, or innovation time.

dev_practices_mentioned.evidence: No development practices (code review, CI/CD, testing, monitoring) mentioned in job description.

innovation_signals.evidence: Focus on Hadoop and Palantir Foundry suggests maintenance of existing systems rather than innovation.

tech_debt_awareness.evidence: No mention of tech debt management, refactoring, or modernization efforts.

ai_integration_level.evidence: No mention of ML, AI, or GenAI in job description or required skills.

ml_tools_expected.evidence: No ML tools (SageMaker, MLflow, etc.) mentioned in job description.

hiring_urgency.evidence: No urgency signals (ASAP, immediate start) in job description.

competition_level.evidence: Atlanta location (lower competition than SF/NYC), but 8-10 years experience requirement may limit pool; no application count available.

company_stage_inferred.evidence: Requires 8-10 years experience and Palantir Foundry expertise, suggesting established company with mature data needs rather than startup.

hiring_velocity.evidence: No mention of team expansion or aggressive hiring; likely backfill for senior role.

team_size_signals.evidence: No information about team size or structure in job description.

funding_stage_signals.evidence: No funding stage information provided in job posting.

role_creation_type.evidence: No indication whether this is a new headcount, backfill, or team expansion.

strengths: Clear, focused senior data engineering role with specific technology requirements (Palantir Foundry, Hadoop, Hive, PySpark)
High experience requirement (8-10 years) suggests senior-level responsibilities and compensation
Onsite requirement in Atlanta may appeal to local candidates seeking stability
concerns: Heavy reliance on Hadoop ecosystem suggests legacy infrastructure and potential tech debt
No mention of modern engineering practices, work-life balance, or growth opportunities
Onsite requirement and 'locals only' may indicate operational pressure or limited flexibility
best_fit_for: Senior data engineers with 8-10 years experience seeking hands-on Palantir Foundry roles
Candidates with Hadoop, Hive, and PySpark expertise looking for stable, onsite positions
Local Atlanta candidates who prefer no relocation and established company environments
red_flags_to_probe: Ask about current data architecture and plans for modernization beyond Hadoop
Inquire about team structure, reporting lines, and opportunities for career growth
Clarify work hours, PTO policy, and any on-call expectations for this onsite role
negotiation_leverage: Rare Palantir Foundry expertise is a strong differentiator for senior candidates
8-10 years of experience justifies premium compensation in this specialized domain
Hadoop and PySpark skills remain valuable for legacy system maintenance roles
summary.overall_assessment: This is a senior data engineering role focused on Palantir Foundry and Hadoop technologies, suitable for experienced candidates seeking hands-on implementation work. The role appears well-defined but lacks signals of modern engineering practices, work-life balance, or growth opportunities. The onsite requirement and legacy tech stack suggest a stable but potentially less innovative environment. Best suited for senior engineers with specific Palantir and Hadoop expertise who prioritize stability over cutting-edge tech.
